TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON , a NORP national born in DATE , lives in GPE . A lawyer by profession , he was at the material time a member of the executive committee of the LOC section of ORG ( “ the HEP ” ) . That party , which was represented in ORG , was dissolved by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the executive committee decided to distribute in the GPE constituency a leaflet criticising the measures taken by the local authorities , in particular against small - scale illegal trading and the sprawl of ORG camps around the city .
The title of the leaflet , of which CARDINAL copies were printed , was “ To all democratic patriots ! ” , and the text read as follows :

“ In DATE a campaign aimed at ‘ DRIVING THE NORP OUT OF THE GPE has been launched in GPE against the NORP population by a combination of prefecture , security police and town hall . In this campaign GPE has been designated a pilot - city . The first stage was the operation [ against ] street traders , stallkeepers and mussel sellers , whom they tried to hide away on the ground that it was necessary to smarten up the city and ease traffic congestion . The purpose of this operation was to impose an ‘ economic blockade’ on our , mainly NORP , fellow citizens who make their living through these activities , condemning them to destitution and starvation . In this way the masses were to be frightened , oppressed and compelled to return to their province of origin .

Before the ‘ DRIVING THE NORP OUT’ campaign began the organisational and psychological ground had already been prepared by leaflets signed by ‘ NORP inhabitants of NORP and handed out in large numbers for DATE by ‘ obscure forces’ . These leaflets incited hostility against the NORP population in particular and stirred up anti - NORP feelings . This led to racist and chauvinistic anti - NORP attitudes through propaganda saying : ‘ Do n’t give employment or housing to the NORP . Do n’t speak to them , do n’t let your daughters marry them and do n’t marry CARDINAL yourself . Smash the GPE That is how the psychological foundations were laid down , the preparations for the future offensives . Although these leaflets were handed out in broad daylight , those responsible – and nobody knows why – were never arrested .

But the campaign was by no means limited to the operation against street traders , stallkeepers and mussel sellers . The second prong was ‘ Operation shantytown’ . The same combination of prefecture , security police and town hall launched the demolition of the ORG camps . It began in PERSON and PERSON and continued in PERSON , [ all ] shantytown districts inhabited mainly by NORP , who , before the elections , were regarded by the parties in favour of the status quo as a source of votes . Those who had encouraged the mushrooming of the shantytowns by dishonestly promising freedom to build in exchange for votes and those who , with the local mafia , had appropriated public land this time set about the ferocious destruction of these huts to oppress and intimidate the NORP and force them to go back home .

The NORP and NORP proletarian people suddenly and without any warning saw the huts they had run into debt to build , with so many sacrifices made by cutting down on their children ’s food , collapsing about their ears . That is how they are trying to oppress the NORP and NORP people and drive them into distress and despair .
IT ’S STATE TERROR AGAINST NORP AND NORP PROLETARIANS !

It is certain that these demolitions , which began in PERSON and are still continuing in PERSON , will soon spread to GPE ’s other shantytowns . The ORG is testing the people ’s reactions and will to resist by causing various kinds of destruction . Passivity as a form of defence against this devastation has encouraged the ORG to commit further kinds of destruction .

In conclusion : The ‘ Driving - the - NORP - Out policy’ forms part of the SPECIAL WAR being conducted in the country at present against the NORP people . It is one of the mechanisms of that war , the way it impinges on the cities . Because the methods used are the same , namely enslavement , violence , terror and oppression through compulsion . It is a psychological war .

While , in the country , they are trying to oppress and silence the people through counter - insurgency tactics , special patrols , village guards , the ORG decree and every [ other ] form of ORG terror , in GPE they want to achieve the same aim by depriving our fellow citizens of their means of subsistence and in the end by knocking their houses down about their ears . The methods used , although different in form , are in the final analysis mechanisms serving the purposes of the special war . It is the urban form of the special war .
TO ALL DEMOCRATIC NORP !
The way to nullify these insults to the cities is to set up ORG BASED ON THE PEOPLE ’S OWN STRENGTH .
We call on all NORP and NORP democratic patriots to assume their responsibilities and oppose this special war being waged against the proletarian people .
LONG LIVE THE BROTHERHOOD OF NATIONS !
STOP THE SPECIAL WAR BEING SPREAD INTO THE CITIES ! ”

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE , accompanied by a copy of the leaflet in question , the president of the ORG informed the GPE prefecture of the executive committee ’s decision ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and asked for permission to implement it .

CARDINAL . NORP The GPE security police , to whom this request had been referred , considered that the leaflet contained separatist propaganda capable of inciting the people to resist the government and commit criminal offences .
On DATE they asked ORG attached to ORG ( “ the public prosecutor ” , “ the ORG ” ) to state his opinion as to whether the contents of the leaflet contravened the law .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the request of the public prosecutor ’s office , a substitute judge of ORG issued an injunction ordering the seizure of the leaflets and prohibiting their distribution .

The police searched the ORG ’s premises in GPE , first at the headquarters , where the party leaders handed over , without demur , CARDINAL copies of the leaflet which were still parcelled up , and then at the ORG district office , where CARDINAL remaining copies were seized .
CARDINAL . Still on DATE the public prosecutor ’s office opened a criminal investigation against the ORG ’s local leaders and the members of its executive committee , including the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor instituted criminal proceedings in ORG against the applicant and the other CARDINAL members of the ORG committee who had taken part in the decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . Citing the text of the leaflet , he accused them of attempting to incite hatred and hostility through racist words and asked the court to apply Articles CARDINAL § § CARDINAL of LAW , LAW no . ORG ) and additional section CARDINAL of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) ( see paragraphs CARDINAL , DATE and DATE below ) . He also asked the court to order confiscation of the leaflets .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , composed of CARDINAL judges , CARDINAL of whom was a member of ORG , found the applicant guilty of the offences charged and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL days’ imprisonment and a fine of MONEY . It also ordered the confiscation of the leaflets and disqualified him from driving for DATE .

In its interpretation of the wording of the leaflet , ORG accepted the public prosecutor ’s oral submissions entirely , except for that part which related to the applicability of the Prevention of Terrorism Act ( Law no . ORG ) . It noted in particular that the leaflet suggested recourse to resistance against the police and the establishment of “ neighbourhood committees ” , which it held to be illegal forms of protest . It further held that the offence had been intentionally committed , since the accused had not contested either the existence or wording of the text on which the charge was based .

With regard to the severity of the sentence , it observed that although commission of the offence through the medium of print was an aggravating circumstance , it was necessary to take into account the accused ’s good faith and the fact that the authorities had been able to lay hands on the leaflets before they had been distributed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and the other convicted persons appealed to ORG . In their notice of appeal they asked for a public hearing to be held and challenged ORG interpretation of the leaflet and its refusal to commute the prison sentence to a fine .

CARDINAL . On DATE May ORG attached to ORG forwarded the case file together with an opinion couched in a standard form of words – which was not communicated to Mr DATE asking the court to uphold the judgment .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ORG upheld all the operative provisions of the impugned judgment , after observing that , regard being had to the nature and length of the sentence imposed at first instance , it was not necessary to hold a hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecuting authorities decided , at the applicant ’s request , to stay execution of the prison sentence for DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ Public incitement to commit an offence

Where the incitement [ to commit an offence ] is done by means of mass communication , of whatever type , by tape recordings , gramophone records , newspapers , press publications or other published material , by the circulation or distribution of printed papers or by the placing of placards or posters in public places , the terms of imprisonment to which convicted persons are liable shall be doubled … ”
“ Non - public incitement to commit an offence
Whosoever expressly praises or condones an act punishable by law as an offence or incites the population to break the law shall be sentenced to DATE imprisonment and a … fine of DATE .

Whosoever expressly arouses hatred and hostility in society on the basis of a distinction between social classes , races or religions , or CARDINAL based on allegiance to a particular denomination or region , shall be sentenced to CARDINAL DATE imprisonment and a fine of DATE . If this incitement is done in a manner likely to endanger public safety , the sentence shall be increased [ by DATE ] .
The penalties to be imposed on those who have committed the above - mentioned offences by the means listed in LAW shall be doubled . ”

CARDINAL , section PERSON ) ) .

CARDINAL of DATE , promulgated with a view to preventing acts of terrorism , refers to a number of offences defined in LAW which it describes as “ acts of terrorism ” or “ acts perpetrated for the purposes of terrorism ” ( sections DATE ) and to which it applies . CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure provides for the holding of a public hearing in proceedings before ORG only where the impugned judgment concerns offences classified as “ serious ” , such as those punishable by the death penalty or a term of imprisonment of DATE . ORG jurisdiction , according to LAW , is limited to questions concerning the lawfulness and procedural regularity of the first - instance judgment .

CARDINAL . ORG were created by PERSON no . DATE of DATE , in accordance with LAW . That PERSON was annulled by ORG on DATE . The courts in question were later reintroduced into the NORP judicial system by LAW . The relevant part of the statement of reasons contains the following passage :

“ There may be acts affecting the existence and stability of a ORG such that when they are committed special jurisdiction is required in order to give judgment expeditiously and appropriately . For such cases it is necessary to set up ORG . According to a principle inherent in our LAW , it is forbidden to create a special court to [ give judgment on ] a specific act after it has been committed . For that reason ORG have been provided for in our LAW to try cases involving the above - mentioned offences . Given that the special provisions laying down their powers have [ thus ] been enacted in advance and that the courts have been created before the commission of any offence … , they may not be described as courts set up to deal with this or that offence after the commission of such an offence . ”
The composition and functioning of ORG are subject to the following rules .

“ In the performance of their duties , judges shall be independent ; they shall give judgment , according to their personal conviction , in accordance with the LAW , statute and the law .

No organ , authority , officer or other person may give orders or instructions to courts or judges in the exercise of their judicial powers , or send them circulars or make recommendations or suggestions to them . ”
“ Judges … shall not be removed from office or compelled to retire without their consent before the age prescribed by LAW … ”
“ Presidents , regular members and substitute judges of ORG shall be appointed for a renewable period of DATE . ”

“ The personal rights and obligations of military judges … shall be regulated by law in accordance with the principles of the independence of the courts , the safeguards enjoyed by the judiciary and the requirements of military service . Relations between military judges and the commanders under whom they serve as regards their non - judicial duties shall also be regulated by law ... ”
